name: Perilous Seat

attributes.attribute: only the finder of the Grail could sit in it without disappearing
sat on the Perilous Seat after his first and failed encounter with the Fisher King
cracked apart to indicate his unworthiness
sitting upon it after successfully finding the Grail and knitting the stone back together

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Arthurian legends feature the Perilous Seat, a location akin to the Celtic Inauguration Stones. It honors genuine heroism, allowing only the adventurer who discovers the Grail to occupy it without vanishing. As some accounts shows, Percival attempted to sit on the Perilous Seat after initially failing to assist the Fisher King. The seat shattered to pieces, indicating his lack of worthiness at the time. Nevertheless, he restored the stone and sat upon it after successfully unearthing the Grail.
